_header: He that has gold and great riches
_description: William Dunbar, ‘Ane his awin ennemy’ — five 5-line stanzas with alternating refrains, ‘He wirkis sorow to him sell’ and ‘I gif him to the dewill of hell’

CamMagPep2553.First Lines:
He þat hes gold and grit rychesAnd may be in to
                    myrrynes…
CamMagPep2553.Last Lines:
…He þat dois on dry breid wirrieI gif him to the dewill
                    of hell
CamMagPep2553.Editions:
Craigie,  William Alexander. 
             The Maitland Folio Manuscript, Containing Poems by Sir Richard
                Maitland, Dunbar, Douglas, Henryson, and others.
             2 vols. 
             Scottish Text Society
         n.s. 7 (1919), 20 (1927); Edinburgh and London: Blackwood, 1919,
            1927: 1.239-40.

Banna.First Lines:
He that hes gold and grit richessAnd may be into
                    mirryness…
Banna.Last Lines:
…he þat dois on dry breid virryI gif him to the devill of
                    hell
Banna.Note: Follows immediately after second occurrence of 1481.
